greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of symbols in Babylonian numeral representation of n.
comment: For a(1)..a(59) this sequence coincides with A007953.
For the sexagesimal - decimal representation of n see A055643.
The values of the positions is given in A281863.
The sum of the digits of A055643(n) = a(n).
The number of digits of the representation of n is given in A282622. (End)
link: Wolfdieter Lang, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
High resolution photographs, descriptions and analysis of the root(2) tablet (YBC 7289) from the Yale Babylonian Collection
program: (PARI) a(n) = n\10 + n%10 \\ for n <= 59. _Michel Marcus_, Jul 12 2013
results.author: Alain Van Kerckhoven (alain(AT)avk.org), Sep 10 2007
ext: Terms a(60)..a(81) from _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 21 2017 (to distinguish it from A007953)
